title: Linux quotaon Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux quotaon command for managing disk quotas. Learn how to enable, monitor, and manage user disk quotas on your file system.

meta.title: Linux quotaon Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux quotaon command for managing disk quotas. Learn how to enable, monitor, and manage user disk quotas on your file system.
meta.keywords: Linux, quotaon, disk quota, file system, user management, system configuration

verify.name: Verify disk quota management is enabled
verify.hint: Ensure that disk quota management is enabled on the root file system (`/`). You can use the `quotaon -a` command to verify the status.

steps.title: Enabling Disk Quota on a File System

verify.name: Verify disk quota is enabled on /data
verify.hint: Ensure that disk quota management is enabled on the `/data` file system. You can use the `quotaon -a` command to verify the status.

verify.name: Verify disk quota limits for labex user
verify.hint: Ensure that the disk quota limits for the `labex` user are set correctly on the `/data` file system.

steps.title: Monitoring and Managing User Disk Quotas

verify.name: Verify disk quota usage for labex user
verify.hint: Ensure that the `labex` user's disk quota usage on the `/data` file system matches the expected output, where the user has exceeded the soft limit of 5000 blocks and is in a grace period.

verify.name: Verify disk quota management commands
verify.hint: Ensure that the `edquota`, `quota -v`, and `quota -l` commands work as expected for the `labex` user.
